test-set.name: prod-ForClause
test-set.description: Tests for the ForClause production (or the ForExpr in XPath)

source.description: Data about a filesystem represented in XML.
Data about a filesystem represented in XMLwith namespace-qualified names .
A Schema validated xml file, that contains values for some of the order by tests generated by NIST.
A Schema validated XML file containing certain special types e.g. interleave types, union types, anySimpleType

schema.description: A Schema containing certain special types e.g. interleave types, union types, anySimpleType

test-case.name: ForExpr001
test-case.description: For+Return - to iterate a constant sequence

test-case.name: ForExpr002
test-case.description: For+Return - error, undefined variable in 'IN' Expr

test-case.name: ForExpr003
test-case.description: For+Return - use predicate in 'IN' Expr

test-case.name: ForExpr004
test-case.description: For+Return - use more than one predicates in 'IN' Expr

test-case.name: ForExpr005
test-case.description: For+Return - use sequence(security/right) as the predicate

test-case.name: ForExpr006
test-case.description: For+Return - 2 For will generate two iterations

result.assert-xml: <fragment-result><Folder name="Folder00000000017" id="67"><file idref="67">File00000000047</file></Folder><Folder name="Folder00000000017" id="67"><file idref="97">File00000000062</file></Folder><Folder name="Folder00000000032" id="97"><file idref="67">File00000000047</file></Folder><Folder name="Folder00000000032" id="97"><file idref="97">File00000000062</file></Folder></fragment-result>

test-case.name: ForExpr007
test-case.description: For+Return - use special character in variable name

test-case.name: ForExpr008
test-case.description: For+Where+Return - use special characters in variable name

test-case.name: ForExpr009
test-case.description: For+Return - error, use variable in it's own declaration

test-case.name: ForExpr010
test-case.description: FLWOR expression with multiple, interdependent variables

test-case.name: ForExpr011
test-case.description: FLWOR expression with multiple, interdependent variables

test-case.name: ForExpr012
test-case.description: Nested FLWOR expressions
test-case.test: for $fileName in for $file in //Folder/File return $file/FileName return string( $fileName )

test-case.name: ForExpr013
test-case.description: Multiple variables based off the same input context

modified.change: reduce the volume of the output

test-case.name: ForExpr014
test-case.description: Incorrect syntax for nested loop. Multiple return statements at the same level
test-case.test: for $fileName in //File/FileName for $folderName in //Folder/FolderName return $folderName return $fileName

test-case.name: ForExpr015
test-case.description: Return expression contains nested for expression
test-case.test: for $folder in //Folder return for $file in $folder/File return string( $file/FileName[1] )

test-case.name: ForExpr016
test-case.description: Interate over nodes in document and constant sequence. Return value based on both

test-case.name: ForExpr017
test-case.description: Multiple return statements from single for expression

test-case.name: ForExpr018
test-case.description: Multiple in statements for single variable binding

test-case.name: ForExpr019
test-case.description: Multiple for statements for single variable binding

test-case.name: ForExpr020
test-case.description: Multiple variable bindings followed by a trailing ,

test-case.name: ForExpr021
test-case.description: Test order of iteration between two variables in the same 'for' statement

test-case.name: ForExpr022
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with positional variable

test-case.name: ForExpr023
test-case.description: Use positional variable in binding for new variable

test-case.name: ForExpr024
test-case.description: Reuse existing variable name for positional variable

test-case.name: ForExpr025
test-case.description: Redefine existing bound variable. Second binding overrides first

test-case.name: ForExpr026
test-case.description: Missing 'in'

test-case.name: ForExpr027
test-case.description: Wrong order for positional variable

test-case.name: ForExpr028
test-case.description: FLWOR expression iterating over constructed XML

test-case.name: ForExpr029
test-case.description: Embedded FLOWR expression that binds same variable on boths expressions (two for clauses)

test-case.name: ForExpr030
test-case.description: Embedded FLOWR expression that binds same variable on boths expressions (use commas)

test-case.name: ForExpr031
test-case.description: FLOWR expression that binds same variable on both ends of "at"

test-case.name: ForExpr032
test-case.description: FLOWR expression with positional binding

modified.change: See bug issue #29358: change spec dependency

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-1
test-case.description: Syntactically invalid for-expression.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-2
test-case.description: Syntactically invalid for-expression.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-3
test-case.description: Syntactically invalid for-expression.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-4
test-case.description: Syntactically invalid for-expression.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-5
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `deep-equal(1 to 5, (for $i in (1,2,3,4,5) return $i))`.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-6
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `3 eq (for $foo in 1 return 3)`.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-7
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `1 eq (for $foo in 1 return $foo)`.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-8
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `2 eq (for $foo in 1 return $foo + 1)`.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-9
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `3 eq (for $foo in 1 return for $foo in 3 return $foo)`.
test-case.test: 3 eq (for $foo in 1 return for $foo in 3 return $foo)

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-10
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `deep-equal((for $var in (1, 2, 3) return $var), (1, 2, 3))`.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-11
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `deep-equal((2, 2), (for $foo in (1, 1) return 1 + $foo))`.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-12
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `4 eq (for $foo in 1, $bar in 2, $moo in 3 return 4)`.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-13
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `3 eq (for $foo in 1 return for $bar in 2 return $bar + $foo)`.
test-case.test: 3 eq (for $foo in 1 return for $bar in 2 return $bar + $foo)

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-14
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `3 eq (for $foo in 1 return for $bar in 2 return $bar + $foo)`.
test-case.test: 3 eq (for $foo in 1 return for $bar in 2 return $bar + $foo)

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-15
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `3 eq (for $foo in 1, $foo in 3 return $foo)`.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-16
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `8 eq (for $foo in 1, $foo in 3, $moo in 5 return $moo + $foo)`.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-17
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `6 eq (for $foo in 1, $foo in 3 return $foo + $foo)`.

test-case.description: A for variable binding to the empty sequence.

test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `(for $xs:name in (1, 1) return $xs:name) instance of xs:integer+`.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-46
test-case.description: Type check: $foo is of type xs:string, which cannot be added to xs:integer 1.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-47
test-case.description: A variable's for expression causes type error in a value comparison.
test-case.test: for $foo in ("a string", "another one") return 1 + subsequence($foo, 1, 1)

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-48
test-case.description: Parser test: variable names in a for expression that only exist of one character are valid.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-49
test-case.description: For-expression involving a simple return statement that in some implementations trigger optimization paths.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-50
test-case.description: Ensure scanners/parsers accept small QNames in for-expressions.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-51
test-case.description: Ensure scanners/parsers accept small QNames in for-expressions(#2).

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-52
test-case.description: A binding in a for-expression shadows global variables.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-53
test-case.description: Ensure the correct variable is used in an for-expression whose return sequence is only a variable reference.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-54
test-case.description: Ensure the correct variable is used in an for-expression whose return sequence is only a variable reference(#2).

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-55
test-case.description: Apply fn:count() to a for-expression.

test-case.name: K-ForExprWithout-56
test-case.description: Apply fn:count() to a for-expression(#2).
test-case.test: count(for $i in (1, 2, timezone-from-time(current-time())) return ($i, $i)) eq 6 or count(for $i in (1, 2, timezone-from-time(current-time())) return ($i, $i)) eq 4

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-1
test-case.description: Keywords are case sensitive.

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-2
test-case.description: A for-expression doesn't create a focus.
test-case.test: declare function local:myFunc() { for $i in (1, 2, 3) return position() }; local:myFunc()

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-3
test-case.description: A for-expression doesn't create a focus(#2).
test-case.test: declare function local:myFunc() { for $i in (1, 2, 3) return position() }; 1

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-4
test-case.description: A for-expression with a positional variable doesn't create a focus.
test-case.test: declare function local:myFunc() { for $i at $p in (1, 2, 3) return position() }; local:myFunc()

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-5
test-case.description: A for-expression with a positional variable doesn't create a focus(#2).
test-case.test: declare function local:myFunc() { for $i at $p in (1, 2, 3) return position() }; 1

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-6
test-case.description: A query that performs up-transformation of dates.
test-case.test: for $ti in <ti><rangeDate><initDate>17880505</initDate><terminatingDate>19550505</terminatingDate></rangeDate></ti> return <result> { fn:min(if ($ti/singleDate) then let $tmp:=$ti/singleDate/compute return xs:date(fn:concat(fn:substring($tmp, 1, 4), "-", fn:substring($tmp, 5, 2), "-", fn:substring($tmp, 7, 2))) else let $tmp:=$ti/rangeDate/initDate return xs:date(fn:concat(fn:substring($tmp, 1, 4), "-", fn:substring($tmp, 5, 2), "-", fn:substring($tmp, 7, 2)))) } </result>

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-7
test-case.description: Ensure use of the undefined focus gets flagged.

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-8
test-case.description: Wrap a path expression.
test-case.test: (for $d in <people> <person id="person0"> <name>First</name> </person> <person> <name>Second</name> </person> </people>/person return if (some $id in 1 satisfies typeswitch ($d/@id) case $n as node() return $d/@id = "person0" default $d return ()) then $d/name else ())

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-9
test-case.description: Ensure positional variables and bindings handles nesting.
test-case.test: for $a at $pos1 in (1, 2, 3) return for $b at $pos2 in (4, 5, 6) return for $c at $pos3 in (7, 8, 9) return ($a, $pos1, $b, $pos2, $c, $pos2)

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-10
test-case.description: Make use of many syntactical combinations.

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-11
test-case.description: The return expression does not depend on the for iteration.
test-case.test: for $a in (3, 2, 1, 1) stable order by $a return 5

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-12
test-case.description: The order by expression does not depend on the for iteration.
test-case.test: for $a in (3, 2, 1, 1) stable order by 1 return $a

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-13
test-case.description: Use the focus from within a for-expression.

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWithout-14
test-case.description: Use the focus from within a for tail-expression.

test-case.description: Use a name test named 'node' inside a for loop, inside a user function.
test-case.test: declare function local:func($arg as element()* ) as element()* { for $n in $arg/element return $n }; 1

test-case.description: Use a name test named 'document' inside a for loop, inside a user function.

test-case.name: ForExprType001
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration (element type)

test-case.name: ForExprType002
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration (attribute type)
test-case.test: for $fileName as attribute(name,xs:untypedAtomic) in (//Folder)[1]/File/@name return data($fileName)

test-case.name: ForExprType003
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration (PI type)

test-case.name: ForExprType004
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration (comment type)

result.assert-xml: <!-- This is an official fsx file -->

test-case.name: ForExprType005
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration (simple type)
test-case.test: for $int as xs:int in (xs:int(1), xs:int(2)) return $int

test-case.name: ForExprType006
test-case.description: Wrong type in type declaration
test-case.test: for $int as xs:string in (xs:int(1), xs:int(2)) return $int

test-case.name: ForExprType007
test-case.description: Wrong order for type declaration

test-case.name: ForExprType008
test-case.description: Wrong order for positional and typing parts of FLWOR expression
test-case.test: for $file at $pos as element(Folder,xs:untyped) in (//Folder)[1]/File return (string($file/FileName[1]), $pos)

test-case.name: ForExprType009
test-case.description: FLWOR with type expression matching a user defined type
test-case.test: declare namespace xqt="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTestOrderBy"; for $num as element(xqt:NegativeNumbers) in /xqt:DataValues/xqt:NegativeNumbers return $num

test-case.name: ForExprType011
test-case.description: FLWOR with type expression referencing an unknown type
test-case.test: declare namespace xqt="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTestOrderBy"; for $num as xs:undefinedType in data( /xqt:DataValues/xqt:NegativeNumbers/xqt:orderData ) return $num

test-case.name: ForExprType012
test-case.description: Missing type declaration on type expression

test-case.name: ForExprType013
test-case.description: Type declaration containing multiple 'as' keywords
test-case.test: declare namespace xqt="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTestOrderBy"; for $num as xs:decimal as xs:decimal in data( /xqt:DataValues/xqt:NegativeNumbers/xqt:orderData ) return $num

test-case.name: ForExprType014
test-case.description: Type expression value is void. This will never match anything bound to a variable by a FLWOR statement
test-case.test: declare namespace xqt="http://www.w3.org/XQueryTestOrderBy"; for $num as empty-sequence() in data( /xqt:DataValues/xqt:NegativeNumbers/xqt:orderData ) return $num

test-case.name: ForExprType015
test-case.description: Type declaration is a super type
test-case.test: for $num as xs:decimal in (xs:integer(1), xs:integer(2), xs:integer(3)) return $num

test-case.name: ForExprType016
test-case.description: Type declaration is a super type of the union type bound to the variable
test-case.test: for $num as xs:decimal in (xs:integer(1), xs:decimal(2), xs:integer(3)) return $num

test-case.name: ForExprType017
test-case.description: Bound sequence is a union type containing a single instance that does not match the type declaration
test-case.test: for $num as xs:double in (xs:int("1"), xs:integer("2"), xs:string("3")) return $num

test-case.name: ForExprType018
test-case.description: Match a 'node' type

test-case.name: ForExprType019
test-case.description: Match a text node type
test-case.test: for $fileName as text() in (//Folder)[1]/File/FileName/text() return string( $fileName )

test-case.name: ForExprType020
test-case.description: Match a 'item' type
test-case.test: for $fileName as item() in data( (//Folder)[1]/File/FileName ) return $fileName

test-case.name: ForExprType021
test-case.description: Match a 'document' type
test-case.test: for $doc as document-node() in (/) return count( $doc )

test-case.name: ForExprType022
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration (attribute type). Simple attribute wildcard

test-case.name: ForExprType023
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration (attribute type). Simple attribute name test (no type)
test-case.test: declare default element namespace "http://www.example.com/typedecl"; for $test as attribute(integer) in ( /root/InterleaveType2/@integer ) return data( $test )

test-case.name: ForExprType024
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration (attribute type). anySimpleType attribute
test-case.test: declare default element namespace "http://www.example.com/typedecl"; for $test as attribute(att, xs:anySimpleType) in /root/anyAtomicType/@att return data( $test )

test-case.name: ForExprType028
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Value subtype promotion: Numeric based types -> integer

test-case.name: ForExprType029
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Value subtype promotion: Numeric based types -> decimal

test-case.name: ForExprType030
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Value subtype promotion: String based types -> normalizedString

test-case.name: ForExprType031
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Value subtype promotion: Time based types -> anyAtomicType
test-case.test: for $test as xs:anyAtomicType in ( xs:duration("P0Y1347M0D"), xs:dateTime("1999-05-31T13:20:00-05:00"), xs:time("13:00:00-05:00"), xs:date("1999-05-10Z"), xs:gYearMonth("2002-03"), xs:gYear("1999"), xs:gMonthDay("--05-10"), xs:gDay("---10"), xs:gMonth("--05") ) return $test

test-case.name: ForExprType032
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Value based subtype promotion: 2nd level derived types

test-case.name: ForExprType033
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Value based subtype promotion: Types from all levels
test-case.test: for $test as xs:anyAtomicType in ( xs:unsignedByte("10"), xs:short("20"), xs:positiveInteger("30"), xs:nonPositiveInteger("-40"), xs:decimal("5.5"), xs:ENTITY("entity1"), xs:NCName("foobar"), xs:language("en-US"), xs:string("foobar"), xs:hexBinary("ffff"), xs:gYear("1999") ) return $test

test-case.name: ForExprType034
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Value based subtype promotion: numeric literal values -> double

test-case.name: ForExprType035
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Value based subtype promotion: string and numeric literal values -> anyAtomicType

test-case.name: ForExprType036
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration (element type). Simple element wildcard
test-case.test: declare default element namespace "http://www.example.com/typedecl"; for $test as element(*) in /root/InterleaveType/* return $test

test-case.name: ForExprType045
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Unknown Type

test-case.name: ForExprType046
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Attempt to promote xs:decimal | xs:double | xs:integer - no common subtype

test-case.name: ForExprType047
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Test matching no atomic simple types
test-case.test: for $test as xs:NMTOKENS in ( xs:NMTOKEN("ab"), xs:NMTOKEN("cd") ) return $test

test-case.name: ForExprType054
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Type declaration matching item() values
test-case.test: declare namespace fs="http://www.example.com/filesystem"; for $test as item() in data( (//fs:Folder)[1]/fs:File/fs:FileName ) return $test

test-case.name: ForExprType055
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Type declaration matching node() values
test-case.test: declare namespace fs="http://www.example.com/filesystem"; for $test as node() in (//fs:Folder)[1]/fs:File return $test/fs:FileName

test-case.name: ForExprType056
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Type declaration matching a document node
test-case.test: declare namespace fs="http://www.example.com/filesystem"; for $test as document-node() in (/) return ($test//fs:Folder)[1]/fs:FolderName

test-case.name: ForExprType057
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Type declaration matching text nodes

modified.change: avoid reliance on implicit document node creation

test-case.test: declare namespace fs="http://www.example.com/filesystem"; document{for $test as text() in (//fs:Folder)[1]/fs:File/fs:FileName/text() return $test}

test-case.name: ForExprType058
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Type declaration matcing XML comment nodes

modified.change: avoid reliance on implicit document node creation

test-case.test: declare namespace fs="http://www.example.com/filesystem"; document{for $test as comment() in (//fs:Folder)[1]/comment() return $test}

result.assert-xml: <!-- This is a comment for File00000000000 --><!-- This is a comment for File00000000001 --><!-- This is a comment for File00000000002 -->

test-case.name: ForExprType059
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Type declaration matcing PI nodes
test-case.test: declare namespace fs="http://www.example.com/filesystem"; for $test as processing-instruction() in (//fs:Folder)[1]//processing-instruction() return $test

test-case.name: ForExprType060
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Type declaration matcing named PI nodes
test-case.test: declare namespace fs="http://www.example.com/filesystem"; for $test as processing-instruction() in (//fs:Folder)[1]//processing-instruction() return $test

test-case.name: ForExprType061
test-case.description: FLWOR expressions with type declaration. Type declaration matcing PI nodes - no matching PI found
test-case.test: declare namespace fs="http://www.example.com/filesystem"; for $test as processing-instruction("unknown") in (//fs:Folder)[1]//processing-instruction() return $test

test-case.test: declare namespace fs="http://www.example.com/filesystem"; for $test as item() in (//fs:Folder)[1]/fs:File/fs:FileName return $test

test-case.test: declare namespace fs="http://www.example.com/filesystem"; for $test as text() in data( (//fs:Folder)[1]/fs:File/fs:FileName ) return $test

test-case.test: declare namespace fs="http://www.example.com/filesystem"; for $test as comment() in (//fs:Folder)[1]/fs:File/fs:FileName return $test

test-case.name: K2-ForExprWith-1
test-case.description: For declarations does not cause type promotions to apply.
test-case.test: for $i as xs:string in xs:untypedAtomic("input") return $i
